answers.answer: HI,You need to get back to your Doctor, for an examination. Oedema that is not responding to treatment will need further evaluation. High blood pressure, renal problems, and cardiac issues need to be rule out. Certain tests may also be necessary. Hope this helps.Take care and good luck.

question: i have type 2 diabetes and every day i have swollen feet and ankles...my doctor has given me pills for the swelling but they do not work....is there anything else that i can try.....the swelling causes my feet to hurt when i walk as my skin droops over right where my ankles bend....i also try and drink as much as i can during the day....help....thank you.....
title: type 2 diabetes, swollen feet and ankles
